name: MyMitsubishiConnect
0:
”Alexa, open My Mitsubishi Connect”
”Alexa, ask My MITSUBISHI CONNECT to enable the battery charging schedule”
”Alexa, ask My MITSUBISHI CONNECT to lock the doors”
skdetail:
Rated: Guidance Suggested. This skill contains: dynamic content.
Invocation Name: my mitsubishi connect
Developer Terms of Use
des:
From the comfort of your home, command your Mitsubishi vehicle with the My Mitsubishi Connect skill for Alexa using just your voice. On an Alexa-enabled device, just ask Alexa to request remote commands be sent to your vehicle, such as remote door lock / unlock, engine on, horn, lights, car finder, and parental controls. Mitsubishi Connect is an innovative platform of services that provide vehicle owners with a safe, secure, and convenient driving experience.

SUPPORTED VEHICLES in United States and Canada:
• 2018 and newer Eclipse Cross (US only)
• 2022 and newer Outlander
• 2023 and newer Outlander PHEV

REQUIREMENTS:
• An active subscription to Mitsubishi Connect
• A Mitsubishi Telematics Control Unit equipped vehicle
• My Mitsubishi Connect login credentials for account linking

SOME OF THE AVAILABLE COMMANDS:
• “Alexa, open my MITSUBISHI CONNECT”
• “Alexa, ask My MITSUBISHI CONNECT to turn on climate control”
• “Alexa, ask My MITSUBISHI CONNECT to enable the battery charging schedule”
• “Alexa, ask My MITSUBISHI CONNECT to enable speed alert”
• “Alexa, ask My MITSUBISHI CONNECT to lock the doors”
• “Alexa, ask My MITSUBISHI CONNECT to turn on the lights”

SETUP INSTRUCTIONS: 
Before linking Mitsubishi Connect with Alexa, you'll need to complete the following, first:
• Have an Amazon account and Alexa-enabled device set up.
• Have a Mitsubishi Connect Remote Services subscription.
• Have a Mitsubishi Connect account set up and linked with your vehicle.

Once the above requirements are completed:
1. Download the Alexa app on your smartphone from (iOS or Android) Amazon Alexa marketplace.
2. Tap the “Menu” on the top left area.
3. Select "Skills".
4. Type “My MITSUBISHI CONNECT” into the “Search Field” and then press the “Magnifying Glass” icon located directly next to the field.
5. Search for “My MITSUBISHI CONNECT”, then select “Enable”.
6. Enter your “My MITSUBISHI CONNECT” login information, then select “Log In”.
7. Once you are successfully linked, voice commands can be triggered following confirmation of security PIN.
